column4: I just switched from Debian to Ubuntu and got a problem with mounting my encrypted (cryptsetup luks) external hard drive. i get prompted for my password and type it in, but i get the message "Could not mount encrypted device. Did you supply a wrong passphrase?" (the password is correct, of course)
are you supplying it a filename or an actual block device?
uhm.. i actually don't know - i only installed crpytsetup and plugged the usb-hd in
I would suggest trying it on the command line
ok, i'll do that. thanks
I'm not saying you won't get the same error message...
this is what i get :/ http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/11566/
I think you're missing kernel modules. try sudo modprobe aes sha256. and if that works, add those modules to /etc/modules
unfortunately loading these modules didn't do the trick
are you sure you have the right device?
yes
try sudo modprobe dm_mod dm_crypt
and this guy seems to have the same problem: http://article.gmane.org/gmane.linux.kernel.device-mapper.dm-crypt/2134
FATAL: Error inserting dm_mod (/lib/modules/2.6.17-11-generic/kernel/drivers/md/dm-mod.ko): Unknown symbol in module, or unknown parameter - dmesg says: "dm_mod: Unknown parameter `dm_crypt'"
maybe this does also help: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/11568/ - thanks for your help btw
oops. try sudo modprobe dm_mod; sudo modprobe dm_crypt
IT WORKS! :) THANKS A LOT!
(sorry for the capslock) ^
don't forget to add those 4 modules to /etc/modules so it will work after you reboot
i will. thanks a lot again :)
